title: How to Make a Temari Ball

steps.title: Cut your styrofoam ball in half and cut a small hollow in the center.
steps.content: Cut your styrofoam ball in half and cut a small hollow in the center.

steps.title: Place a small jingle bell or noisy object in the center and place the two halves together again with the jingle bell inside.
steps.content: Place a small jingle bell or noisy object in the center and place the two halves together again with the jingle bell inside.

steps.title: Cut two rectangles from your batting or old blanket.
steps.content: Cut two rectangles from your batting or old blanket. They should wrap 3/4ths of the way around the balls circumference lengthwise and be at least half the ball circumference in width.

steps.title: Wrap the rectangle around the styrofoam ball.
steps.content: Wrap the rectangle around the styrofoam ball.

steps.title: Pin the two rectangles to your styrofoam ball.
steps.content: Pin the two rectangles to your styrofoam ball. Place the short end of one against the middle of the longer side of the other.

steps.title: Wrap them around and place pins to hold them in place.
steps.content: Wrap them around and place pins to hold them in place.

steps.title: Cut off any excess material, leaving two "dumbbell" shaped pieces of batting pinned to the ball.
steps.content: Cut off any excess material, leaving two "dumbbell" shaped pieces of batting pinned to the ball.

steps.title: Begin to wrap your base color of string.
steps.content: Begin to wrap your base color of string.

steps.title: Remove the pins as soon as the string is sufficiently wrapped to make the pins unnecessary.
steps.content: Remove the pins as soon as the string is sufficiently wrapped to make the pins unnecessary.

steps.title: Continue to wrap your base color randomly around your styrofoam ball until all of your batting is covered.
steps.content: Continue to wrap your base color randomly around your styrofoam ball until all of your batting is covered.

steps.title: Cut the string, thread it's end through a large needle, and sew it into the ball to hold it in place.
steps.content: Cut the string, thread it's end through a large needle, and sew it into the ball to hold it in place.

steps.title: Mark the poles and equator of your string ball with pins.
steps.content: Mark the poles and equator of your string ball with pins.

steps.title: Wrap and/or embroider the ball in contrasting colors in any pattern of your choice.
steps.content: Wrap and/or embroider the ball in contrasting colors in any pattern of your choice. The example was made extremely simple for ease of explanation, but there are many more complicated and interesting designs "out there". (see citations below)

steps.title: Sew all ends into the ball to secure them.
steps.content: Sew all ends into the ball to secure them.

steps.title: Use the ball as a decoration, as a gift, or as a child's toy.
steps.content: Use the ball as a decoration, as a gift, or as a child's toy.
